Uses of Interface
items.Item

  • Packages that use Item 
    Package Description
    entities.characters  
    items  
    items.consumables  
    items.weapons  

    • Uses of Item in entities.characters

      Methods in entities.characters with parameters of type Item 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void AbstractChar.equip(Item a)
      This method lets the character equip a weapon in their inventory.
      void AbstractChar.get(Item a)
      This method adds an item to the character's inventory at the end.

    • Uses of Item in items

      Methods in items with parameters of type Item 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Item.equals(Item other)
      Checks if this item is equal to another item by comparing the names and every stat.

    • Uses of Item in items.consumables

      Subinterfaces of Item in items.consumables 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  Consumable
      This interface starts the Consumable branch of items and contains the statements .getBuffedStat(), .getMod(), .setMod(), .getDuration(), .setDuration(), .apply(), and .remove().
      Classes in items.consumables that implement Item 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractConsumable
      This class handles the getters and setters for the Consumable family of classes, as well as the .equals() and .toString() methods.
      class  AbstractTimedConsumable
      This class differentiates itself from the regular AbstractConsumable by also containing a .remove() method, which removes the bonus from the target Character.
      class  DefensePotion
      This class of Consumable is a Defense Potion, an item common to many RPGs.
      class  HealthPotion
      This class of Consumable is a Health Potion, an item common to many RPGs.
      Methods in items.consumables with parameters of type Item 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean AbstractConsumable.equals(Item other)
      Checks if the other item is an instance of a consumable, then checks the names, buffed stats, modifier values, and durations.

    • Uses of Item in items.weapons

      Subinterfaces of Item in items.weapons 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  Weapon
      This interface starts the Weapon branch of classes, and contains the statements .getDmg() and .setDmg().
      Classes in items.weapons that implement Item 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractWeapon
      The class that handles all of the getters and setters for the Weapon type, as well as the .equals() and .toString() methods.
      class  Dagger
      This class of Weapon represents the damage a character would do when equipped with only the barest minimum of gear.
      class  Fist
      This class of Weapon represents the base damage a character would do, effectively by "punching" their target.
      class  ShortSword
      This class of Weapon represents the damage a character would do when equipped with some base gear.
      Methods in items.weapons with parameters of type Item 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean AbstractWeapon.equals(Item other)
      Checks if the other item is an instance of a weapon, and then compares their names and damage stats.
